result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sharaf Akhmedov

21CF416 & 22CF66 - 1:24 PM Defendant Sharaf Akhmedov in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Sharaf Akhmedov. Cheryl Schmidt appears under SCR 50 for the State of Wisconsin. State informs the Court the investigation will conclude in mid November.
Further proceedings scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on October 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Case to be rescheduled as Court is not available on 9/20 at 1:30 pm. Atty. Steinle waiting for additional information. DA Gerol no objection to adjournment.

Judge Williams sitting for Judge Malloy-Cases 21CF416 & 22CF66 called together - 1:20 PM Defendant Sharaf Akhmedov in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Sharaf Akhmedov. Atty. Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Gerol states there is forensic accounting being done before case can proceed further. Atty. Steinle concurs. Atty. Steinle motion to modify bail conditions. State no response as to victims wishes. Victim statement requested contact with defendant on 22CF66-current no contact provision except phone on 22CF66. Court: Motion granted as follows-Victim and Def can have face to face for the sole purpose of exchanging the children.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
CASH BOND PREVIOUSLY POSTED in amount of $25,000.- No contact with A.O. Defendant's wife N.O. and Defendant permitted to have face to face contact for the sole purpose of exchanging their children.
Further proceedings on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court reviewed letter, letter of N.O. to be addressed on 7/19 court date.

CASH BOND PREVIOUSLY POSTED- No contact with A.O. Contact with defendant's wife (N.O.) is by phone only. Defendant may have in person contact only for the purposes of exchanging the children at the Grafton Police Dept in their parking lot.

Cases 21CF416 / 22CF66 - 1:28 PM Defendant Sharaf Akhmedov in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Sharaf Akhmedov. Benjamin Lindsay appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. No contact with A.O. Contact with victim N.O. by phone or face to face while defendant is in the Ozaukee County Jail. If defendant is released from custody, Court will review the contact between defendant and victim N.O.

Cases 21CF416 / 22CF66 called together - 1:29 PM Defendant Sharaf Akhmedov in court in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. MIchael Steinle.  Attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for State of Wisconsin.   Atty. Steinle motion for bail modification. State opposes motion. Court denies motion as to bail amount. Victim requests contact between defendant and herself. Court will allow face to face/ telephone contact between defendant/victim while incarcerated.  If defendant posts bail, court will review contact between victim/defendant.
Further proceedings scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:10 PM Br 3 sitting for Br 1. Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Sharaf Akhmedov appeared by video, in custody of OZSD. Atty Michael Steinle appears for defendant via Zoom video conferencing. Counsel waives reading of complaint. Court finds probable cause. State requests $50,000.00 cash bail. Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.
Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
